newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE white sugar remains softer, closes lower.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE white sugar remains softer, closes lower.

text.p: White sugar futures remained in the minus column during slow Monday evening LIFFE trading, closing easier.
Traders said the market continued to cue off a lower CSCE in New York, where there was appeared to be little sign of followthrough fund buying from last Friday.
Instead of chasing up to re-test Friday's October position high, the New York market tailed lower on producer pricing, they noted.
In physicals, Syria has tendered to buy 26,000 tonnes of white sugar and 26,000 of raws for October delivery, as an amendment to the August 7 tender.
LIFFE October closed at $326.00 a tonne, down $2.60 from Friday. Turnover was a light 773 lots.
